name: Blue Dolphin Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night on our drive from L.A. to San Francisco and it was the perfect stopping point. The room was enormous, the bed super comfy and everyone working there was so friendly. Having breakfast delivered to our door in the morning was lovely, I just wish that we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved this place! Our room was so incredible. It was spotless clean, tastefully decorated, comfortable and over looking the ocean. There was a birthday cake in the room waiting for us on our arrival. I can't say enough about this place. We booked our next getaway as we were checking out. We will be going back in 6 months. I agree with a previous review, ceramic coffee cups would be nice since they do provide wine glasses and drinking glasses. That is really the only suggestion I have. They hit the mark on everything else.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stop your research, you have found the perfect pause to perch on your roadtrip down the coast. This hotel is elegant, clean, and calm. After a long drive (neglecting to monitor sunset time and overstaying our break in Big Sur) that had us clutching the steering wheel for nearly three hours in total darkness, pulling into Cambria was relief in and of itself, but walking into the beautiful oceanfront room was bliss. I am a Four Seasons type of girl and can proclaim that these are the BEST pillows I ever enjoyed at a hotel (and want to buy them for my home). Walking the bucolic beach paths in front of the hotel post breakfast and watching a harbor seal teach her two hour pup to swim was majesty that set the stage for the continuing drive to LA. Book your room, you won't be sorry. Would stay here again in a heartbeat, and I am fussy!
reviews.title: excellent overnight spot between SF and LA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We spent three nights at the Blue Dolphin Inn while visiting Cambria and Paso Robles for the Zin Festival. It was a warm and welcoming place to return to each evening after a full day of wine tasting and general frivolity. The rooms were nice, the price was right, and they brought a lovely breakfast to our room each morning. I would highly reccommend this lovely establishment.
reviews.title: Wonderful and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I was looking for a quiet and quaint place to meet my daughters for the weekend, and Blue Dolphin Inn was perfect. It is very clean, simply elegant and friendly responsive service. We have definitely started a new tradition and Cambria's Blue Dolphin Inn is the place to do it. Its located across the street from the beach, great walking path, close to restaurants and shops. The ideal weekend.
reviews.title: Mother/Daughter Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned to the Blue Dolphin Inn because there is nothing more satisfying for weary lives than the beauty of the Pacific Ocean right across a tiny street. You can almost touch it from your room.
reviews.title: Even Better Than Last year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We remembered the wonderful treatment we received every time we had a need or request and looked forward to coming. Said simply, each and every thing that the staff could provide to make us feel well treated was offered generously.
reviews.title: Beautiful Moonstone Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: For simple luxury, I can not recommend the Blue Dolphin more highly.
reviews.title: Perfect stopover...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for the first time last summer. Cambria is one of our favorite destinations and have sampled the area's numerous lodgings. This was one of our favorites for various reasons. First, the location: the inn is directly across the street from Moonstone Beach and having close access was a great plus. Secondly, the bed was one of the most comfortable, and we both slept extremely well.
reviews.title: Great Little Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room and inn are well appointed and the concierge gave us a quick tour and available amenities at check-in. Having a nice robe and slippers added to the feeling of being pampered. The entire inn was well appointed, clean and welcoming. The beverage table in the lobby area had a nice variety of teas and there were fresh cookies each afternoon.
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Blue Dolphin Inn was a disappointment. Surprisingly, the reviews have been good for this hotel, however my experience was different. Cambria is a cozy, laid back beach town with spectacular views and a boardwalk to walk along and experience the sights. We saw plenty of seals up close. The Inn is located directly on a busy main street along the water. The sound of vehicle traffic is not relaxing or particularly enjoyable especially when paying top dollar for an oceanfront room. The carpet in this top dollar oceanfront room was filthy with stains and unidentifiable dirt spots throughout. Also, insulation seems thin as we could hear people above us too well. There was no bottled water either in the rooms or available for purchase just a Keurig in the room for hot tea or coffee. There is no store or other available place within walking
reviews.title: Pretty view, but hotel not worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: distance to purchase drinks. Service here was also not great. The lady checking us in was nice enough, but she checked us into the wrong room and seemed confused. The Inn is just not worth the price. The feel is more of a motel. Visit Cambria for the scenery, but pass on staying here.
reviews.title: Sleep with the sound of the ocean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a recent trip down Highway 1, we decided to stay in Cambria one night to relax and go to Hearst Castle. We chose the Blue Dolphin Inn out of a long list of hotels right on Moonstone Beach. We lucked out! We booked a room with a partial ocean view but when we arrived, we requested an upgrade to a full ocean view. It was a small increase in the cost, but completely worth it. We had a gorgeous corner room, with a king 4 poster bed, a sitting area and a fabulous bathroom. The bath amenities were top notch and the room was pristine. All of this would have been enough to make us want to come back but the bonus? They bring you breakfast! I had a very good ham and egg in a puff pastry and my hubbie had a bagel w/lox. Great quality, wonderful experience. Will definitely go back.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience in Cambria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the wonderful and friendly service, to the beautifully appointed rooms, to the freshly baked cookies and delicious breakfast picnics, the Blue Dolphin Inn has it all. We went to Cambria for one night just to see Hearst Castle, but could have easily stayed more to enjoy the hotel and the beautiful location by the beach. It's easy to see that the management team cares about the hotel and guests - well done!
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Well Appointed Rooms - Highly Recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small couples only property designed for those who don't mind spending a little more for a nicer room and everything that goes with it. We felt like we had a little apartment by the sea for the week and didn't want to leave. The entire property is neat and clean top to bottom.
reviews.title: Overated for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My son and I stayed in the Junior suite - comfortable beds, nice decor, very good feel to the place. Staff were friendly and helpful - even at 3am when I needed to Skype across the world!
reviews.title: breath of fresh air

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All in all an excellent experience thoroughly recommended for stylish, unpretentious comfort..
reviews.title: Gorgeous Location Across from Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: It is not the fanciest place on Moonstone Drive, but it is always, consistently, one of the best. Beautiful location...the ocean is directly across, welcoming staff, very comfortable rooms. For a little extra cost you can stay at the Cottages, same owners. Both are wonderful. Stayed here many times over the years.
reviews.title: Always worth the stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night here, on a mini road trip on PCH, driving from LA to SF. One of closest places you can stay if visiting the Hearst Castle (at least if driving from the South). Our room was nice and spacious, very convenient and nice. Bathroom very nice and must have been renovated recently. The free wifi worked perfectly.
reviews.title: Great place to stay close to the Hearst Castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good - comes in a paper bag which is convenient - there are several benches overseeing the ocean across the street, makes a great setting to enjoy it.
reviews.title: A Bit of Paradise in Cambria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend to anyone driving on PCH and looking for a nice place to stay close to the Hearst Castle
reviews.title: loved it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I decided to take a mini road trip up to Cambria to celebrate New Years Eve. We reviewed our hotel options on TripAdvisor and decided that the Blue Dolphin Inn was the place to stay. Thank you, TripAdvisor Reviewers! We could not have been any happier with the hotel. It was the nicest hotel in Cambria. Let me break it down for you:
reviews.title: OK, but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Blue Dolphin Inn is a fantastic vacation location and resort. The staff are tremendous, the rooms very nice and very clean, and the location could not be better. Thank you especially to the "desk personnel" Janet, Jill, and Lupe for your friendliness and hospitality.
reviews.title: Blue Dolphin Inn Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here over President's Day weekend and found the Inn to be exceptional. Clean rooms, nice appointments, friendly staff and scrumptous boxed breakfast!! We come to Cambria often and have found our new place to stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Blue Dolphin recently because we got a very good deal on our room. As others have said the service and amenities are quite nice. The room itself was well appointed and very comfortable. All of the staff were also quite helpful.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't have much of a view from our room but that wasn't important to us. The boardwalk is directly across the street and gave us ample opportunity to enjoy the ocean and the antics of the very friendly ground squirrels that live next to the beach.
reviews.title: Truly Charming Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property is very quaint. There are beautiful appointments throughout. The staff is lovely and genuinely care about your comfort and enjoyment. Great location. Makes for a perfect romantic get away.
reviews.title: What a nice inn!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wanted to plan a romantic getaway for my wife and I, and since she had talked about the beautiful town of Cambria for years, I decided to take her there. I looked online at the hotels in the area, and the Blue Dolphin Inn has good reviews and it looked intriguing. Cambria aside, and I would move there tomorrow if I had the money, the Blue Dolphin Inn was the best choice for an Inn that I could have made.
reviews.title: Best Hotel That I Have Ever Stayed at...Seriously!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located right across from the beach, the Blue Dolphin Inn is smaller in size than most places that I have stayed, but what it lacks in size it makes up for in superior quality. When we arrived we were greeted warmly by the front desk receptionist and shown to our beautiful room. The room itself had a faux fireplace/heater, beautiful framed pictures of the area hung on the wall, an oceanside view, comfortable bed, great bathroom and such a warm feeling throughout. My wife melted! They offer breakfast delivered to your room in the morning with thoughtful food options and to go containers that show a consideration to their guests and the fact that when you are in Cambria you are on the go. We enjoyed so much about the Blue Dolphin Inn, but for me the fact that you can simply walk outside, cross a very short road, then you are at the beach...it is just the icing on the cake.
reviews.title: Now here is the place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been to the Hyatt Regency in Maui, the Marriott, and many other hotel with stellar reputations, and I would take The Blue Dolphin Inn over every single one of them. There is no doubt, I will be back to Cambria and this is the only place that I will stay while I am there.
reviews.title: Blue Dolphin - yes; Moonstone Drive - no

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We have stayed in a lot of different kinds of hotels, motels, B&Bs, etc. This place is unique and very fine...wish they were a chain, would stay nowhere else.
reviews.title: Home away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the outside it looked a little like motel. Inside, a small elegant lobby with coffee and tea on a sideboard. Signed in and walked to our ocean front lower level with a patio in front to sit and look at he ocean (blankets in the closet to use if cold). The room was well decorated, if not huge, with a fireplace and Kurig coffee maker. It was perfect. Then came the "picnic" breakfast, which was wonderful with a breakfast sandwich, sweet roll, orange juice. You order this the night beforehand from a menu of choices and it was delivered at your specified time in the am.
reviews.title: First Trip to Cambria, Blue Dolphin Inn Made It Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superb. Recently updated. The staff are great; Very helpful and accommodating. The location is perfect.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in Cambria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Really hard to find anything to complain about with this place. Extremely clean and stylish, and rooms had some nice amenities. Nice coffee maker, fireplace, really comfortable beds, and even a lighted mirror for makeup in the bathroom. They delivered breakfast to your rooms in the morning at your chosen time. Staff was very nice. Actually led us to our room and showed us how things worked. Nice touch.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Well, maybe The Venetian in Vegas was better, but this was very stylish, peaceful and had a wonderful location next to the beach. We drove to Cambria by accident and just walked in, but it was a perfect place for a one night stay, a bit pricey though. (The reason for us visiting Cambria was that someone told us there are retired millioinaires, but we couldn't find any. My friend is still single. ;)
reviews.title: The best hotel of the road trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: We loved this hotel! The rooms were very nice ( especially for the price) and the location was great. The best part about this hotel was the service!! The hotel staff went out of their way to ensure that we were comfortable. They are extremely friendly and ready to help. The hotel offers free breakfast delivered directly to your room. The selection was pretty good, we definitely weren't able to eat everything though. We will definitely be back to the blue dolphin!!
reviews.title: We will be back!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was lovely, one of our favourite hotels on our drive from San Diego to San Fran. The rooms were modern and well equipped with high quality equipment. Staff were very welcoming and helped us with restaurant reservations. We got an upgrade to a room with a better view as the hotel was quiet. There were some nice touches... the reception had chairs and towels for the beach, the rooms had big blankets to sit and watch the stars under and a torch to walk along the street with. The breakfasts (packed to take away) were amazing... never knew a packed breakfast could be so tasty. Would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Romantic inn, lovely views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from our CA vacation. We only got to stay at the Blue Dolphin Inn for one night but we just loved it. We stayed in a second-story corner room facing the ocean. The room has a name, not a number and I can't remember how to spell it but it was awesome! When you first see the Inn, it looks like someone's well-maintained little home but it's very big inside and very elegant. The picnic breakfast was very good and we enjoyed eating it on the beach while watching the seals. Don't want to repeat everyone else's comments - all the good is true. We had the bagels 'n lox and egg breakfasts, which were both very good. There's a stand beneath a tree in the back with things to wash your car windows but you can also use the cloths to wash the sand off your feet. Beach towels are in a basket in the reception area. We bought a robe - it's so awesome! If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask.
reviews.title: All the great reviews are true

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My hubby and I came up here last weekend to escape the madness in Southern CA for Labor Day. We lucked out and selected Blue Dolphin. We come to Cambria at least once a year for a getaway, and LOVE this town. ALWAYS stay on Moonstone beach, regardless of the hotel you choose. Most of them are pretty nice, we've stayed in a few. But this one stood out! It's a much smaller hotel, but absolutely guest-focused. All the staff is really nice, most of them will address you by name, you get homemade cookies in your room every day! A boxed breakfast of your choice is included in your stay each day, your room has a Kuerig machine with all kinds of coffee/tea blends, the lobby has hot cocoa, coffee, tea and lemon water each morning and evening, free Wi-Fi, free unlimited movie rentals from their huge collection- I could go on and on. We stayed in room 100 which literally backs up to the lobby (it's right behind the front desk). I was a little apprehensive about potential noise or privacy with people coming/going, but never had any issues. The hotel is really quiet and nice. I believe it is adults only, so no screaming kids running down your hall in the morning. =) It's a cozy and beautiful hotel. Although the rooms were beautifully decorated, had fireplaces, and the bathrooms were beautiful- most of the hotels we have stayed at on Moonstone I could say the same for. What REALLY makes Blue Dolphin shine and totally sets it apart are the goodies!!! (FREE Wi-Fi/ FREE delicious breakfast you actually want to eat/AWESOME staff/FREE unlimited movie rentals/cookies in your room each afternoon). We will definitely be back!!!!
reviews.title: Gem with the Goods!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Loved every moment here, from the comfy beds and well-thought out renovation of the rooms, to the excellent take-away breakfast! Great idea! The staff were all very sweet and friendly--loved them and loved the VERY loud sound of the ocean as we went to sleep. Went with girl friends from High School, and it couldn't have been more perfect--but it's plenty romantic too!
reviews.title: Super re-do of this excellent little gem!
The reviews are correct, this is a great place
reviews.text: We read many of the reviews before we booked this place. Yes, I could nit pick a bit. There is traffic, during daylight hours, between then Inn and the ocean. Full ocean front rooms are pricey (300+). Not many (1) restaurants within walking distances, rooms are about ready for some TLC (caulk in bathroom) but we did not come here expecting an ocean front resort experience but rather a relaxing get away and they get 5 stars for that. Reception desk staff was very pleasant, got us checked in early, gave us a tour of our room and recommended various dining options. The room was well appointed and on the second floor directly overlooking the ocean across the street. The breakfast was delivered promptly with a hot ham and egg sandwich as well as varied pastries. You are given a choice of items at check in. The sound of the ocean breaking on the beach and rocks is amazing and almost loud at night. Wish we were staying for more than one night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No children at the Blue Dolphin Inn contributes to the quiet, relaxed, and peaceful atmosphere. The rooms are fairly large and well-appointed, and the ocean can be heard from every room. We like to take our preordered breakfast across the street, sit on a bench and watch the ocean. If you like to socialize with other guests around the pool or the breakfast table, this is probably not the place for you. But if you like to spend most of your time walking along the beach watching pelicans, otters, and squirrels, and then come back to a cozy room----this is the place for you. It's an easy walk into town and perusing the various shops. Be sure to walk about 100 yards to eat at the Moonstone Grill. Sit outside and watch the sunset over a glass of wine.
reviews.title: Adults only -----yes!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a deluxe, partial view and were literally across the street from the sea. We could hear the waves, which I find soothing. The room was spacious and just loved having the Keurig coffee maker and fresh cookies in the room.
reviews.title: Went with Mom, want to return with Husband

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The front desk staff was friendly and I changed our dinner reservations based on her recommendation. We went to the Sea Chest, in walking distance and was one of the best fish places I have been to. So glad we took her recommendation.
reviews.title: Nice Stop on the Coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The town was cute but preferred the walks along the water. They have a well designed walkway, but walking along the beach is equally as enjoyable.
reviews.title: Inn-side view
Proximity to the ocean
reviews.text: Breakfast is brought to the room and there are several choices. It's not an over abundence, but we were satisfied with it. They need mugs for the coffee and they let me know they are on order.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms across from ours with the full view are quite spectacular. They book quickly, so I would love to plan ahead and stay in one of those with my husband.
reviews.title: Amazing Stay
Charming property
reviews.text: The hotel is clean and well appointed. Booking a room with a patio was worth the extra money. We loved sitting outside and had a great view. The hotel is across the street from the water, but traffic was not really an issue. The picnic breakfast is a nice touch. Cambria has a nice Main St. and the property is within a few miles from Hearst Castle. Overall, the property is a little pricey, but I would not hesitate to recommend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The minute I walked into the lobby, I could tell that I was going to really like this place. I was greeted with a kind smile and warm consideration. I love the decor, cute little fireplace (electric) and the room was well laid out. And, the best part....once the window was cracked open, I could hear the ocean. I would highly recommend this property to anyone. Thanks Blue Dolphin!
reviews.title: Modern Coastal Living Accomodations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the blue dolphin inn as part of our honeymoon road trip of California. Admittedly, I went into our stop in Cambria with minimal expectations, and the BDI would just be an overnight stay in order to break up the driving... How wrong I could of been!
reviews.title: Do not underestimate... It's amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is beautifully located with merely a (quiet) road separating you from the ocean. Upon arrival we were greeted warmly, and made to feel right at home. Being led to our room and shown around (by christina, if i recall) was one of those minor touches that you don't get with the huge chain hotels, making the experience instantly feel more personal and friendly.
reviews.title: What a find!!! ...and reasonably priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room (saldanah room) was cosy, beautifully decorated, and the view was amazing. The sound of the waves outside adds to the tranquility of the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Blue Dolphin is a beautiful little inn right on the beach in Cambria, with terrific views of the Pacific Ocean from many rooms. Our room had just about any amenity you could imagine and some we couldn’t (I had never seen a working fireplace in a hotel room before – great touch). Staff were very helpful with local advice and in meeting specific requests. They have no breakfast room, so a reasonable “breakfast picnic” is delivered to your door each morning, which you can eat in your room, on your patio (if you have one) or in a number of other suggested scenic spots nearby, weather permitting. Be forewarned – there is a two-lane road between the inn and the beach, so if you have one of the ground floor rooms facing the oceanfront, your view will be compromised periodically by passing cars. You can avoid that by getting a second floor room, which will have an unobstructed view, but no patio. It’s a tradeoff. All in all, we had a wonderful experience and would highly recommend the Blue Dolphin.
reviews.title: Beautiful Inn With Great Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our visit to the Blue Dolphin Inn. The rooms are lovely and it is right across the street from Moonstone Beach that has a beautiful walking path. They bring breakfast to your room each morning and there is always coffee available. The views are stunning. We rode our bikes to Hearst Castle and back on Rt 1 and there was little traffic to worry about. The town of Cambria is also lovely and laid back.
reviews.title: Beautiful, beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really nice inn. Our room was standard and it was spacious, although the bed was a little small and we didn't have a view. The location is perfect, right on the beach and having fresh coffee in the morning was a good touch. 15 mins north is the elephant seal beach, well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Perfect stopping place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Look no more simply the best place , The room was beautiful and comfortable and beyond clean , wish I stayed more days but I will come back cambria and will only stay here
reviews.title: simply the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Saldana, on the second floor with an ocean view. The decor was soothing with muted colors, which blended perfectly with the view. The room was perfect, but we had a few issues with housekeeping. After checking into our room, we noticed a net bag hanging by the door. Upon further inspection, we discovered someone's dirty clothing. We dismissed this as an oversight, and the front desk apologized. We were out most of the next day, returning around 9PM to find that housekeeping had not cleaned our room! Once again the receptionist apologized, took the trash, brought us refills of coffee and said she would report it to the management. At checkout the next day, she explained she did not have time to report these issues. Although she was courteous and brought us some chocolates, this is not acceptable when I paid over $500 for two nights. Hopefully, this is not their normal standard.
reviews.title: Great room, but poor housekeeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Blue Dolphin Inn for 3 nights and found the accommodation, service and box breakfast faultless. I can recommend the Blue Dolphin Innto anyone travelling up the Californian coast to visit Hearst Castle. Cambria is the closest township to the Castle, and a superb little spot with great ocean views, and a cute town centre.
reviews.title: Superb accommodation on the Central Coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: So many hotels here and we chose by TripAdvisor and it was right on with this one . King bed, super comfy, electric fire place is sweet enough and the ocean is across the street. Ours is not a water view but you can hear the surf. Breakfast comes in a bag with a knock at the door at your chosen time - is just handed over so no intrusion- so the not gourmet breakfast seems pretty gourmet!
reviews.title: Perfect gracious hotel for Hearst Castle and on to -or from- BugSur.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cookies, little chocolates, Keurig, tea, robes,... It has aplenty.
reviews.title: whale watching from the comfort of your room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Book an ocean view(top floor) in this charming small hotel. Great service and breakfast is included. It is delivered to your room. Binoculars are provided and you sit back and look out your window. Best time to go is the first couple of weeks in January(the whales are going down to Baja to have their babies) or April/May on their way back. The other plus of visiting in January is that a lot of their restaurants have promotions and wonderful set menus.
reviews.title: All In the Details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed here twice and plan to visit again as much as possible. Located right (literally) across the street from the Pacific, you cannot beat the location of this little hotel. We enjoyed taking walks along the well-maintained boardwalk across the road and could even hear the waves from our room.
reviews.title: Loved The Blue Dolphin!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love Cambria and have been there many times. This was one of my best trips there, thanks to the Blue Dolphin! We had an oceanfront room and could hear the wonderful sounds of the ocean. I would have been happy sitting by the window all day. The room was beautiful and comfortable. The soaking tub was a bug plus! Breakfast served to your room and fresh cookies hanging on your door in the afternoon...they really make you feel welcome. Lots of little touches that add so much! It was the most relaxing experience I have had in a long time. We'll be back!
reviews.title: You won't want to leave
Great for rest relaxation and romance
reviews.text: Stayed for three nights over a weekend in the middle of our road trip from San diego to San Francisco.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The deluxe king side room was so comfortable, and quiet, and with the sounds of waves crashing (occasionally drowned out by cars from CA1) it was heavenly. We could even see the waves crashing onto the beach from out little seating area in our room, which was lovely.
reviews.title: Love the Blue Dolphin!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can not ever say enough to sufficiently praise every aspect of our stay. However I shall try.
reviews.title: Everything About The Experience Was Abundant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: First reservations: I made and altered our reservation more than once, as we were not only celebrating a birthday, but also because we decided to invite friends, as one of them was also having a birthday. Then we added another night. With each change, and question I raised, the reservations staff was helpful and patient.
reviews.title: Clean & Classy Grownup Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had never been to Cambria so this was my first trip. This hotel sits right on the beach along with several other similar properties. I booked a ocean view room. We did indeed have a view from one side window. Well, that was the only downer. The room was wonderful. Breakfast was just the right amount and of good quality, staff are great Would definitely stay again but specify a ocean FACING room.
reviews.title: Very Nice, quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I chose to stay here to visit the Hearst Castle and were very pleasantly surprised by our lovely accomodations and the warmth and professionalism of the staff. From the ocean view to the comfort of the bed and furnishings to the delicious breakfast service, our experience was just perfect! We would definitely recommend the Blue Dolphin Inn and plan to return whenever we're in the area!
reviews.title: Perfect experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: I booked this hotel because I wanted to be closed to Hearst Castle and take a rest before the trip from Big Sur to SF. I read here that this hotel was excellent and went there. It was the best hotel of the trip. They gave us the room "Sea of Japan". We were in 4 women and we felt extremely protected... The staff were kind, could see the smallest detail... And the view... One of the best views we had... Go there if you want to feel comfortable and want to see seals, sunset... Good trip!!!
reviews.title: Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accomodations at the Blue Dolphin were excellent - good sized room, great bed and linens, excellent bathroom, considerate blanket to use on the terrace. i would go again. the fruit and cheese plate (extra charge) was ample and the fruit excellent.
reviews.title: very nice room and bath, lousy breakfast, didn't call re lost items

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast box was inadquate in every way - no milk for the coffee (which i expressly asked for), the quality of the food was mediocre and the portion small, and the presentation a zero.
reviews.title: It was a very Happy Anniversary

description: Family owned and operated, The Blue Dolphin Inn is located on Moonstone Beach Drive where the "Sea meets the Pines."The Inn offers cozy rooms, all with comfortable king or queen beds and fireplaces. In room amenities include European blend coffee and Dorothy Prentice bathroom amenities. In the morning you will enjoy a deluxe continental breakfast and in the afternoon tea, cookies and sparkling cider. Be sure to take advantage of our California vacation packages.
